body_html:
Correct me if I'm wrong @martinwicke, I believe that if you specify model_dir to the classifier constructor, you will get an autosaved model i.e.

import tensorflow.contrib.learn as learn

def input_fn():
    foo=tf.constant([1.,2.,3.])
    bar=tf.constant([0,1,0])
    return {"x":foo}, bar
classifier = learn.LinearClassifier(n_classes=3,model_dir="/tmp/cool-awesome-model")
classifier.fit(input_fn=input_fn, steps=200)

Let me know if this fixes your issue.

body:
Correct me if I'm wrong @martinwicke, I believe that if you specify model_dir to the classifier constructor, you will get an autosaved model i.e.

``` python
import tensorflow.contrib.learn as learn

def input_fn():
    foo=tf.constant([1.,2.,3.])
    bar=tf.constant([0,1,0])
    return {"x":foo}, bar
classifier = learn.LinearClassifier(n_classes=3,model_dir="/tmp/cool-awesome-model")
classifier.fit(input_fn=input_fn, steps=200)

```

Let me know if this fixes your issue.
